revised_title: A Study of Appendicularia and Doliolum: Ascidian Genera and Their Significance
tldr: Thomas Huxley's paper discusses the unique characteristics and significance of Appendicularia and Doliolum, two Ascidian genera. Appendicularia represents the larval state of Ascidians, while Doliolum serves as a link between Pyrosomata and Salpoe. The paper also raises questions about the independence of Doliolum and its potential relation to the genus Auchenia.
